blog.name: nightqueendany
blog.title: The Daenerys Defense
blog.description: Hi, I'm Lauren. I'm a Santa Cruzian. Yes as in Banana Slugs. Yes, as in the tee-shirt John Travolta wears in Pulp Fiction. I'm a GOT fan. Daenerys stan. I try to be diplomatic but sometimes swear words come out. Deal with it.  Sideblog for asks: asknightqueendany.tumblr.com

summary: I have some random question but what exactly can be defined like a parallel and what exactly is a foreshadowing because I feel...
question: I have some random question but what exactly can be defined like a parallel and what exactly is a foreshadowing because I feel in general the GoT fandom tend to reach to stuff is not even intended to be that way. Care to explain me?
answer:
Sorry it’s taken me so long to get to this! I wanted to give a thorough answer!

So, let’s talk about foreshadowing first. 

Foreshadowing is a literary device which: refers to the use of indicative words or phrases and are hints that set the stage for a story to unfold and give the reader a hint of something that is going to happen without revealing the story or spoiling the suspense. Foreshadowing is used to suggest an upcoming outcome to the story. 

So basically, foreshadowing is something an author or storyteller will put earlier in a story in order to hint at a future event.

A clear and very sneaky example of this in GOT is the very first episode. When Ned is sentencing the Night’s Watch deserter to die, when he says the words King of the Andals and the First Men - the camera is on JON. Telling the audience that the real King of the Andals and the First Men is Jon Snow. Wild right?? 

Another great S1 GOT foreshadow moment is when Jon asks about his mother and Ned uses the phrase I promise - because Ned frequently thinks about his promise to Lyanna - the promise that he would keep her son safe. 

Parallel is a bit harder to define so I’ll do my best. Parallel is best represented by the literary device: Foil and Mirror. The foil character may be completely opposite to the protagonist, or very similar with one key difference. The foil character is used to highlight some particular quality or qualities of the main character.

Now, it is important to note, a FOIL is not always an antagonist. An antagonist is: a character who works in opposition to the protagonist. The antagonist is in direct conflict with the protagonist and presents obstacles to the protagonist achieving his or her goal.

I think a lot of people like to paint Daenerys as an antagonist to Jon or, you know, his future villain/arch nemesis but this is just not the case. Do they begin their relationship somewhat antagonistic towards each other? Absolutely. But even within the first episode where they meet, 7x03, this is reconciled by Daenerys granting Jon leave to mine the dragonglass. An antagonist would be working against Jon’s interests but Daenerys, by giving him the dragonglass, is helping him get past his obstacles (need weapons to fight army of the dead), not putting obstacles in his way. 

A great non-GOT example of foils that aren’t antagonists is Harry Potter and Neville Longbottom. The two characters have many things in common, stories that parallel each others, and yet they have a few key differences as well. Both Harry and Neville lost their parents and are forced to live with another relative they are not fond of. Both were born at the end of July and could have been the Chosen One based on Telawney’s prophecy. Both have a strong sense of right and wrong and both want to fight for good and defeat evil. Yet Harry is much more hot headed and rash whereas Neville is much more reserved and cautious. Harry in the end is destined for a solo showdown against Voldemort and Neville is the one who rallies and leads an army against the Death Eaters. Different yet the same.

Thanks for the ask!

blog.title: Daenerys Targaryen is my queen forever and ever 🔥
blog.description: Mabe. | 19. | Peruvian. | Writer of fanfics. | Film student. | Jonerys (they deserved better) and Romanogers (they too) shipper. | Love GoT, LOTR, HP, Disney and Marvel with my life 💓.

summary:
I really hope we do get a scene with Jon and Daenerys SMILING at each other, and why not laughing with each other...
I know that...
body:
I really hope we do get a scene with Jon and Daenerys SMILING at each other, and why not laughing with each other…

I know that Winter is here, but I don’t want to see my babies depressed and scared during the whole Season 8 😩😭

reblog.comment:
I really hope we do get a scene with Jon and Daenerys SMILING at each other, and why not laughing with each other…

I know that Winter is here, but I don’t want to see my babies depressed and scared during the whole Season 8 😩😭

I really hope we do get a scene with Jon and Daenerys SMILING at each other, and why not laughing with each other…

I know that Winter is here, but I don’t want to see my babies depressed and scared during the whole Season 8 😩😭

I know that Winter is here, but I don’t want to see my babies depressed and scared during the whole Season 8 😩😭
